abstract.text: Any route reference codes that appear on guide signage for the road leading from this step’s maneuver to the next step’s maneuver.

inlineContent.text: This property is typically available in steps leading to or from a freeway or expressway. This property contains route reference codes associated with a road later in the route. If a highway ramp is itself part of a numbered route, its reference code is contained in the
property. For the signposted exit numbers associated with a highway exit, use the

A route reference code commonly consists of an alphabetic network code, a space or hyphen, and a route number. You should not assume that the network code is globally unique: for example, a network code of “NH” may indicate a “National Highway” or “New Hampshire”. Moreover, a route number may not even uniquely identify a route within a given network. A destination code for a divided road is often suffixed with the cardinal direction of travel, for example “I 80 East”.

abstract.text: Quickly get driving, cycling, or walking directions, whether the trip is nonstop or it has multiple stopping points.

object represents a single distinct maneuver along a route and the approach to the next maneuver. The route step object corresponds to a single instruction the user must follow to complete a portion of the route. For example, a step might require the user to turn then follow a road.
Any route reference codes that appear on guide signage for the road leading from this step’s maneuver to the next step’s maneuver.
